alert.note: Alert for Humacao; Maunabo; Naguabo; Patillas; Yabucoa (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 19 at 1:14AM ADT until September 19 at 7:00AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Humacao County in Puerto Rico... Maunabo County in Puerto Rico... Naguabo County in Puerto Rico... Patillas County in Puerto Rico... Yabucoa County in Puerto Rico... * Until 600 AM AST. * At 1214 AM AST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 10 and 16 inches of rain have fallen since early morning on Sunday. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1.5 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 4 to 8 inches are possible in the warned area due to hurricane rainbands. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of mainstem rivers, as well as creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Rio Blanco continues in flood, causing flooding along low lying areas of road number 191 and road number 31. Road 31 and 191 are impassable. Road number 31 where it intersects with Road number 3(HWY 53)could become impassable. Road 182 in Yabucoa may be flooded in several sectors.Road 184 impassable at Barrio Jagual. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
